info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 4:27PM MDT until June 23 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL STILLWATER COUNTY... At 427 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen according to radar estimates near Rapelje. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area over the next half hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, rural roads, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rapelje and Hailstone Wildlife Refuge. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sixshooter Creek and Cummin Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
